Class RemoteApiFactory

    public class RemoteApiFactory
extends com.caucho.hessian.client.HessianProxyFactory
    A special HessianProxyFactory for stateful RemoteService connections

      • connect

        public RemoteApi connect(RemoteSession session,
                java.lang.String url)
                  throws java.net.MalformedURLException
        Create a new RemoteService connection to an already existing RemoteSession at the specified URL.

        Note:

        • You must not call RemoteApi.login(String, String) or RemoteApi.logout(String) on the returned RemoteApi
        • You can directly invoke RemoteApi methods by passing the RemoteSession.getToken()
        Parameters:
        session - is the RemoteSession whose token must be a valid (HttpSession/RemoteSession) token and that can optionally contain additional cookies
        url - is the RemoteApi URL
        Returns:
        a RemoteService interface connected to the already existing (Remote)Session at the specified server
        Throws:
        java.net.MalformedURLException
        Since:
        CB-6.0.2

      • connect

        public RemoteApi connect(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                java.lang.String url)
                  throws java.net.MalformedURLException
        Create a new RemoteService connection to the RemoteApi of the local server as the current HttpSession user
        Parameters:
        request - must be valid HttpServletRequest with a valid HttpSession and user
        url - is the RemoteApi URL, e.g. Config.getRemoteApiUrl()
        Returns:
        a RemoteService interface connected to the RemoteApi of the local server server
        Throws:
        java.net.MalformedURLException
        Since:
        CB-5.5.1

      • connect

        public RemoteApi connect(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
                  throws java.net.MalformedURLException
        Create a new RemoteService connection to RemoteApi of the local server as the current HttpSession user. This method constructs a RemoteApi URL based on the specified request: "<scheme>://<servername>[:<port>]/<contextPath>/remote-api".
        Alternatively, you could also call connect(HttpServletRequest, String) with Config.getRemoteApiUrl() as URL parameter.
        Parameters:
        request - must be a valid HttpServletRequest with a valid HttpSession and user
        Returns:
        a RemoteService interface connected to the RemoteApi of the local server server
        Throws:
        java.net.MalformedURLException
        Since:
        CB-5.5.1
